lead_paragraph: David Beckham was not expected to see much, if any, action, last night when the Los Angeles Galaxy played Chelsea in his first scheduled game with his new team.Beckham was treated for an injured left ankle behind closed doors Friday, while the rest of his teammates trained. He was not scheduled to start last night’s exhibition, and whether he played would be a last-minute decision, Galaxy Coach Frank Yallop said.“He desperately wants to play,” Yallop said. “It won’t be a big part in the game, we know that, because he hasn’t trained for a number of weeks, but we’re hoping he can get some time on the field.”But Yallop cautioned that Beckham’s health is the Galaxy’s top priority, ahead of pleasing sponsors and broadcasters.“What we won’t do is put him in harm’s way,” Yallop said. “If he’s not ready to go, we cannot do that. I’m hoping that everything will be O.K. to at least get him on the field.”That could mean that Beckham, a 32-year-old midfielder, plays only a few minutes in front of a sellout crowd of 27,000 and a live television audience.
